header_summary: Samson Mow questions the 180-year planning limit, comparing it to the invention of electric motors and light bulbs.Davidson Souza announces the development of `libfloresta`, a compact Bitcoin full node for low-power devices.Floresta is backward compatible with Bitcoin Core's RPC commands and aims to provide a user-friendly experience.The BIP for Silent Payments has undergone revisions, introducing a versioning scheme for silent payment addresses.

recent_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
recent_posts.summary:
- Samson Mow questions the 180-year limit for planning, suggesting a longer timeframe.
- Peter Todd counters, stating that 180 years is indeed a long time.
- Todd provides perspective, mentioning the significance of agriculture for 12,000 years.

recent_posts.title: Announcing Libforesta
recent_posts.summary:
- Davidson Souza has developed `libfloresta`, a Utreexo-powered Bitcoin full node with integrated wallet.
- Targeting low-power devices, the project is written in Rust and has early-stage functionality.
- Davidson plans to use `libbitcoinkernel` in the future for consensus and seeks feedback on the project.

recent_posts.title: BIP352: Silent Payments
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP for Silent Payments has undergone review and revision, including changes to key types and address encoding.
- The specification provides guidelines for scanning transactions, shared secret derivation, sender actions, and receiver actions.
- Silent payments is a protocol for sending Bitcoin transactions, focusing on privacy and usability.

recent_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
recent_posts.summary:
- The ideal data collection period should be limited to six months and provide aggregated results.
- Data sharing will follow best practices and anonymization, ensuring no further sharing occurs.
- Timestamps can be fuzzed to protect privacy, as only the resolution period matters for analysis.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a keysend protocol for multipath payments in the Lightning network.
- The scheme involves embedding a preimage in the keysend and generating a payment hash.
- Receivers can claim the payment once all parts have arrived, enhancing payment flexibility.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- Our team has been recording and transcribing specification meetings since the beginning of the year.
- The transcripts are now available to everyone at [https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification](https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification).
- Gurwinder from Chaincode has provided valuable assistance in reviewing and ensuring accuracy of the transcripts.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The context discusses the implementation of a blinded version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- A server, referred to as party 1, is fully blinded and should not learn specific information.
- The protocol involves key aggregation, nonce aggregation, and computing a final signature.

active_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
active_posts.summary:
- The author has proposed enabling full-replace-by-fee (full-rbf) by default in Bitcoin Core.
- Around 40% of Bitcoin hash power mines full-rbf replacements, and various block explorers and nodes have enabled full-rbf.
- The author argues for enabling full-rbf by default to address the issue of limited relay support.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions".
active_posts.summary:
- A significant bug related to "inscriptions" in recent Bitcoin software versions needs attention.
- The bug leads to a rapid growth of inscriptions on the blockchain, causing issues.
- There is a need for a feature allowing users to reject inscriptions in the mempool.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team patched an exploit that allowed attackers to create balances via invoices.
- Users should update to LNbits version 0.10.5 to prevent similar exploits in the future.
- Attackers manipulated payment hashes to trick the LNbits backend and "create" funds.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
active_posts.summary:
- The annual specification meeting took place in late June in New York City.
- Attendees experimented with taking transcript-style notes, available at the provided link.
- Gratitude was expressed towards long-distance travelers and Wolf for hosting the event.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network hide receiving nodes among anonymous users.
- Payments can only be made through these paths, potentially limiting access to certain nodes.
- Concerns arise about privacy compromise and the need for trade-offs in ensuring receiver privacy.
